com.ssdd.cs.bean

Class CriticalSectionQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ssdd.cs.bean.CriticalSectionQueue

  • public class CriticalSectionQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    manages the critical section queue in a synchronized way.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Héctor Sánchez San Blas, Francisco Pinto Santos

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.util.logging.Logger LOGGER
      Class logger generated with SSDDLogFactory.logger(Class)
      private boolean queueingAllowed
      flag that indicates that the queuing is allowed
      private java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Semaphore> waitingProcesses
      queue of semaphores where the threads are waiting

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CriticalSectionQueue() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate()
      enables the queuing, allowing processes to wait in the critical section in the waitInQueue() method.
      void deactivateAndRelease()
      disables the queuing, forbidding processes to wait in the critical section in the waitInQueue() method.
      void waitInQueue()
      synchronously checks if the queuing is allowed.

        private boolean queueingAllowed
        flag that indicates that the queuing is allowed

        queue of semaphores where the threads are waiting

    • Constructor Detail

      • CriticalSectionQueue

        public CriticalSectionQueue()

    • Method Detail

      • activate

        public void activate()
        enables the queuing, allowing processes to wait in the critical section in the waitInQueue() method.

      • deactivateAndRelease

        public void deactivateAndRelease()
        disables the queuing, forbidding processes to wait in the critical section in the waitInQueue() method. Also releases all processes waiting in waitInQueue(), making a release over every Semaphore, and cleans the waitingProcesses list.

      • waitInQueue

        public void waitInQueue()
        synchronously checks if the queuing is allowed. In that case instances a Semaphore with 0 permits and pushes it into the waitingProcesses list. Then goes out the synchronized code fragment and waits for the semaphore. In the case that is not allowed, the semaphore is not instanced, and in the not synchronized part of the method, is not waited for.
